titleStmt.title: W. R. Vance et al. to the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
CWG9249

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Honourable body of the Senate Kentucky the undersigned your petitioner would respectfully represent to your honorable body that they have learned a bill has passed the House of Representatives Amending our town Charter of ^Columbus^ and whereas the said Charter of the said Town of Columbus as promoted does not make it necessary for the board of Council to be bonified property holders of ^in^ said town We your petitioner would ask your honorable body to Amend the the said charter of the town of Columbus so as to make it a necessary for qualification for the councilman to have been bonified ^Real estate^ property holders ^and citizens^ in said town for Three months prior to the election & should they cease to be property holders then they vacate said office of councilman
